Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partly grey-black in section, the interior is slightly grooved and covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, only a very small section of the outer surface, with a light-brown slip and remains of a number of lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now survives.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393301) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393301)
